title: Pep Guardiola puts in claim for most awkward interview of all time (Video)
text:
Pep Guardiola puts in claim for most awkward interview of all time (Video) By Rebecca Knight   Not a happy bunny 
Pep Guardiola has one of the best reputations in football. 
His time at Barcelona and Bayern Munich made him one of the most sought after managers – but after moving to the Premier League, he’s found things aren’t as easy as he may have thought. 
Manchester City are lagging in the title race, and spent the first day of the New Year outside of the top four. 
Barcelona and Bayern are both in leagues they can dominate – whereas in England, there are four, five or even six sides that can all challenge for the title, and even the sides fighting for their lives at the bottom of the table can beat you on their day. 
Not something Pep might’ve expected – nor was the collapse of his side over the last month and a half. 
After seeing midfield man Fernandinho get sent off for the third time in his last six games, Pep was not impressed, and despite City beating Burnley, the post match interview made for pretty awkward viewing. 
And is well on its way to going viral. Obviously. Have a look
